    Create a Scaled SVD Object from a Human Mortality Database File

    ssvd_hmd.Rd

    Create an object of class "bage_ssvd" from a zipped file downloaded from the Human Mortality Database.

    Usage

    ssvd_hmd(zipfile, transform = c("log", "logit", "none"))

    Arguments

    zipfile

    The name of a zipped file downloaded from the Human Mortality Database. Any path name that can be handled by utils::unzip().

    transform

    "log", "logit", or "none". Defaults to "log".

    Value

    An object of class "bage_ssvd"

    Warning

    This function, an associated functions, will probably be moved into a separate package in future.

    Usage

    Step 1: Download data

    Register or log in at the Human Mortality Database, and go to page Downloading the HMD in zipped data files. Go to the "Previous Versions" table at the bottom of the page, and download a file from the "Statistics" column, eg file

    https://www.mortality.org/File/Download/hmd.v6/zip/all_hmd/hmd_statistics_20240226.zip

    To download a file, you will need to register with the Human Mortality Databse and log in.

    Step 2: Call function 'svd_hmd'

    Put the file into the working directory, and supply the name of the file to function svd_hmd(), eg

    MyHMD <- svd_hmd("hmd_statistcs_20240226")

    Step 3: Use object to create a prior

    mod |>
  set_prior(age ~ SVD(MyHMD))

    See also

    • SVD(), SVDS(), ESVD(), ESVDS() to use an object of class "bage_ssvd" in a prior.

    On this page
